tool.name: BandPassFilter

param.name: input_raster
param.dialogReference: Input geophysical raster dataset for band-pass filtering.

param.name: low_cut
param.dialogReference: Wavelengths longer than this will be attenuated (regional removal). Typical values: 20000-100000 meters.

param.name: high_cut
param.dialogReference: Wavelengths shorter than this will be attenuated (noise removal). Typical values: 1000-10000 meters.

param.name: high_transition_width
param.dialogReference: Transition width for high-pass component to reduce ringing artifacts.

param.name: low_transition_width
param.dialogReference: Transition width for low-pass component to reduce ringing artifacts.

tool.summary: Isolate anomalies within specific wavelength ranges by removing regional trends and noise
tool.usage:
Band-pass filtering isolates geophysical anomalies within a specific wavelength range by removing both long-wavelength regional trends and short-wavelength noise. The filter uses smooth transitions to minimize ringing artifacts.

Filter design:

• Low cutoff removes longer wavelengths (regional trends)

• High cutoff removes shorter wavelengths (noise, shallow sources)

• Transition widths create smooth cutoffs to reduce ringing

Choose cutoff wavelengths based on target source dimensions and survey characteristics.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Band-pass filtering isolates geophysical anomalies within specific wavelength ranges by removing regional trends and noise using frequency domain techniques.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Isolation of anomalies within specific wavelength ranges for targeted geophysical interpretation.
dataIdInfo.useLimit: Cutoff wavelengths should be chosen based on target source dimensions. Very narrow bands may amplify noise. Test different parameters on subsets first.
